result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Cobe Anderson

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
8:48 AM Defendant Kenneth Cobe Anderson in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde in court for Kenneth Cobe Anderson.  Prosecuting attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Van Kerkvoorde heard; requesting Preliminary Hearing. Discussion held. Time limits previously waived. Court adjourns to next week for Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim or victim business. Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

12:56 PM Defendant Kenneth Cobe Anderson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Teri Strohschein appeared by video for Kenneth Cobe Anderson - eligible.  Prosecuting attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim or victim business. Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

12:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Findley appears in court. Jail currently on lock down, def unable to appear. Discussion held. Initial to be held tomorrow at 12:45pm.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 12:45 pm.
Initial appearance on September 1, 2022 at 12:45 pm.
